Dan came for Julie at six.

ko: 댄은 진짜 4차원이야. 다음에 무슨 짓을 할지 전혀 감이 안 와.

en: It is getting cooler and cooler.
His true colors are coming out.
The days are getting longer and longer.
It will get warmer and warmer.
The weather here is getting cold and I really do not like that.
ko: 여기 날씨가 점점 추워지는데, 난 추운 거 진짜 싫어.

en: It's getting colder and colder.
It was getting dark.
It is getting darker and darker.
We were running out of gas, and what was worse, it began to snow heavily.
ko: 기름은 다 떨어져 가는데 엎친 데 덮친 격으로 눈까지 펑펑 내리기 시작했어.

en: How would you like to join the dance club?
Will you play some dance records?
Dancing is a delight to me.
What time does the dance floor get crowded?
How would you like to go to a dance?
Dancing is good for the figure.
I cannot dance worth a damn.
Do you like dancing?
Let me dance with you.
We had a lovely time at the dance.
Please enjoy yourself at the dance.
My mother will attend to the baby while I go to the dance.
ko: 내가 춤추러 간 동안 엄마가 아기 봐주실 거야.

en: Why don't you come dancing with me?
I take dancing and modeling lessons.
I found what I was looking for in the drawers.
What a pity you can't dance!
ko: 너 춤 못 춰서 정말 아쉽다!

en: The dancer's graceful action charmed the audience.
Each movement of the dancer was perfect.
The dancers timed their steps to the music of the band.
ko: 댄서들이 밴드 음악에 맞춰서 스텝을 밟았어.

en: The dancers really came to life during the Latin numbers.
ko: 라틴 음악이 나올 때 댄서들이 정말 생기 넘치더라.

en: The tank has a capacity of fifty-gallons.
There's little water in the tank, if any.
A tanker is a ship carrying oil.
I have a lot of phlegm.
Taro succeeded to his late father's estate.
Taro, go and brush your teeth.
The tanker has only a small crew on board.
ko: 그 유조선에는 승무원이 몇 명 안 타고 있어.

en: I wonder who to invite.
I love you more than anyone else.
No one encouraged her.
None were satisfied.
None were listening to the speaker.
ko: 아무도 연설자 말을 안 듣고 있었어.

en: Nobody was paying attention to her.
Nobody argued against choosing him as chairman.
ko: 걔를 의장으로 뽑는 데 반대하는 사람이 아무도 없었어.

en: No one can separate them.
ko: 아무도 걔네 둘을 갈라놓을 수 없어.

en: No one ran ahead of him.
No one had the heart to say he was wrong.
ko: 차마 걔가 틀렸다고 말할 수 있는 사람이 아무도 없었어.

en: No one conceived his words to be important.
ko: 아무도 걔 말을 중요하게 생각하지 않았어.

en: Nobody knows why he left the town.
ko: 걔가 왜 마을을 떠났는지 아무도 몰라.

en: No one can achieve anything without effort.
ko: 노력 없이는 아무것도 이룰 수 없어.

en: Nobody could give the correct answer.
The plants must have died because no one watered them.
ko: 아무도 물을 안 줘서 식물들이 다 죽었나 봐.

en: Nobody likes to be made fun of in public.
ko: 사람들 앞에서 놀림 당하는 건 아무도 안 좋아해.

en: No one forgot their assignment, did they?
No one wants to have an accident. The trouble is that people do not want hard enough to not have an accident.
ko: 사고가 나길 바라는 사람은 아무도 없어. 문제는 사람들이 사고가 안 나길 간절히 바라지 않는다는 거야.

en: No one can help me.
None of us want to go, but either you or your wife has to go.
ko: 우리 중 아무도 가고 싶어 하지 않지만, 너나 네 아내 둘 중 한 명은 가야 해.

en: Everyone is ready.
Everyone, it seemed, was anxious to get their Christmas shopping done early this year.
ko: 다들 올해는 크리스마스 쇼핑을 일찍 끝내고 싶어 하는 것 같았어.

en: Everyone praises the boy.
No one could find the cave.
Don't let anyone come near the fire.
ko: 아무도 불 근처에 못 오게 해.

en: No man alive would believe it.
ko: 살아있는 사람이라면 아무도 그걸 안 믿을 거야.

en: Nobody has seen the bird fly.
ko: 그 새가 나는 걸 본 사람이 아무도 없어.

en: It seems that no one knows the truth.
It seems that no one knew the truth.
It is interesting that no one noticed that mistake.
ko: 아무도 그 실수를 눈치 못 챘다니 신기하네.

en: No one can understand how the accident happened.
ko: 사고가 어떻게 났는지 아무도 이해를 못 해.

en: Everyone was enjoying the journey.
Everybody knew her true feelings.
ko: 다들 그 애 속마음을 알고 있었어.

en: Everybody knows for a fact that he is still alive.
ko: 그 사람이 아직 살아있다는 건 다들 아는 사실이야.

en: What person does everyone take off his hat to?
Everybody is calling for sweeping reforms.
Not everyone can be a poet.
ko: 누구나 시인이 될 수 있는 건 아니야.

en: Everyone is entitled to be moody once in a while.
ko: 누구나 가끔은 기분이 안 좋을 수도 있지.

en: Not everybody can be a poet.
ko: 누구나 시인이 될 수 있는 건 아니야.

en: Everyone was bustling about.
Everybody showed sympathy toward the prisoner.
She assumed that everyone would be for the plan.
ko: 걔는 모두가 그 계획에 찬성할 거라고 생각했어.

en: Everybody expected the musical to be a great hit, but it was far from being a success.
ko: 다들 그 뮤지컬이 대박 날 줄 알았는데, 성공이랑은 거리가 멀었어.

en: Everybody respects Jeremy because he carries out all his responsibilities.
ko: 제레미는 자기 책임을 다해서 모두가 존경해.

en: Everyone is an entrepreneur.
Nobody knows what has become of him.
ko: 그 사람이 어떻게 됐는지 아무도 몰라.

en: No one ever saw such a thing.
ko: 아무도 그런 건 본 적이 없어.

en: Whose go is it?
Everyone seems to have a bone to pick with someone, but only a few people can be philosophical about it.
ko: 다들 누구한테 불만이 있는 것 같지만, 그걸 초연하게 받아들이는 사람은 별로 없어.

en: Let no one interfere with me.
Every man has his faults.
That should be pleasing to anyone.
ko: 그건 누구에게나 기분 좋은 일일 거야.

en: Who is to blame for the failure?
Who were you talking with?
You must make an effort to get along with everyone.
ko: 모든 사람이랑 잘 지내려고 노력해야 해.

en: Everybody has some good points and bad points.
It is necessary that everybody obey the law.
Everyone is more or less interested in art.
ko: 누구나 예술에 어느 정도는 관심이 있어.

en: Everyone more or less likes showing off in public.
ko: 사람은 누구나 남들 앞에서 어느 정도 뽐내는 걸 좋아해.

en: Nobody likes being laughed at.
ko: 비웃음 당하는 걸 좋아하는 사람은 아무도 없어.

en: Everyone has a right to enjoy his liberty, and all the more, his life.
ko: 누구나 자유를 누릴 권리가 있고, 삶은 더더욱 그렇지.

en: Everybody seeks happiness.
You can invite any person you like.
ko: 네가 좋아하는 사람은 누구든 초대해도 돼.

en: Everyone was more or less interested in the arts.
ko: 다들 예술에 어느 정도는 관심이 있었어.

en: Every one wants to live free from care.
ko: 누구나 걱정 없이 살고 싶어 해.

en: Anybody can make a mistake.
All are welcome.
Everyone must keep the law.
It seems that everybody likes golf.
No one man could do it.
ko: 혼자서 할 수 있는 일이 아니야.

en: Not everybody succeeds in life.
ko: 모든 사람이 다 성공하는 건 아니야.

en: Everybody loves music.
Everybody knows the news.
Everyone and everything moved much faster now than before.
ko: 사람들도 그렇고 모든 게 예전보다 훨씬 더 빨리 돌아가.

en: Anyone can use this dictionary.
Everyone is not honest.
ko: 모든 사람이 다 정직한 건 아니야.

en: Give it to whoever needs it.
Everyone is responsible for his own actions.
ko: 누구나 자기 행동에 책임을 져야 해.

en: Not everyone can be a KRS-ONE.
Everyone of us will have to accept the current of the times.
ko: 우리 모두 시대의 흐름을 받아들여야 해.

en: Everyone makes a mistake at times.
Everyone remembers the happy days of his youth as his halcyon days.
ko: 누구든 젊은 시절의 행복했던 때를 인생의 황금기로 기억해.

en: I want someone to talk to.
ko: 나 누구랑 얘기 좀 하고 싶어.

en: Whoever comes, I'll welcome him warmly.
Whoever comes, don't open the door.
Who invented the telephone?
Who should look after the elderly?
There is no telling who will be sent in his place.
ko: 그 사람 대신 누가 올지는 아무도 몰라.

en: There is no doubt as to who will be elected.
Who left the window open?
If you have a bone to pick with a person, tell it to his face instead of saying things behind his back.
ko: 누구한테 불만 있으면 뒤에서 말하지 말고 대놓고 말해.

en: There's somebody here who did it, isn't there?
ko: 여기 이거 한 사람 있지, 그치?

en: Whoever may oppose my plan, I will carry it out nonetheless.
ko: 누가 내 계획에 반대하든 난 그대로 밀고 나갈 거야.

en: Who has taken my handbag?
Do you know who conquered Mt. Everest first?
ko: 에베레스트산을 누가 제일 처음 정복했는지 알아?

en: No matter who may go, he will be welcomed.
Somebody's at the porch!
Someone is at the door.
Who cares?
Who is going to look after our dog?
Who cared?
We will settle once for all who is the best.
Who is in fault?
To understand someone is to love someone.
ko: 누군가를 이해한다는 건 그 사람을 사랑한다는 거야.

en: You should not cut in when someone else is talking.
ko: 남이 말할 때 끼어들면 안 돼.

en: When you shake hands with somebody, you must look him in the eye.
ko: 누구랑 악수할 때는 상대방 눈을 똑바로 봐야 해.

en: I wonder who discovered it.
Who can put a bell on the cat?
ko: 누가 고양이 목에 방울을 달 수 있겠어?

en: Who will compensate for the loss?
ko: 이 손해는 누가 보상해 줄 거야?

en: It is still a mystery who wrote the letter.
ko: 그 편지를 누가 썼는지는 아직도 수수께끼야.

en: Someone will do that job.
Who looks after the children?
Who is behind the plot?
ko: 이 음모의 배후에 누가 있는 거야?

en: Who painted these pictures?
Whoever may say so, it is wrong.
Who wrote this book?
Who has torn the envelope open?
Who made the doll?
Who made this plan?
Somebody, open this door, please.
Tell whoever comes that I'm out.
It smells as though someone has been smoking in here.
ko: 여기서 누가 담배 피운 것 같은 냄새 나.

en: Someone entered the room.
Somebody must care for the patient.
He heard someone calling for help.
ko: 누가 도와달라고 부르는 소리를 걔가 들었대.

en: Someone grabbed me from behind.
Someone seems to be calling me.
Someone hit me on the back.
Somebody took away my bag.
Someone is at the front door.
Someone is calling you.
Someone must have taken my umbrella by mistake.
ko: 누가 내 우산을 실수로 가져갔나 봐.

en: If there is somebody to back me up, the business will be successful.
ko: 뒷받침해 줄 사람만 있으면 이 사업은 성공할 거야.

en: If anyone should phone, say I'll be back at one o'clock.
ko: 혹시 전화 오면 나 한 시에 돌아온다고 전해줘.

en: Someone has left a bag on the bench.
Somebody is playing the piano.
Somebody is playing the piano. It must be Ann.
They had been dancing for an hour when there was a knock on the door.
ko: 한 시간 동안 춤을 추고 있었는데 문에서 노크 소리가 들렸어.

en: Someone is battering at the door.
Someone is tapping at the door.
He thought someone had put poison in his soup.
ko: 그는 누가 수프에 독을 넣었다고 생각했어.

en: Someone has torn two pages out of this book.
ko: 누가 이 책에서 두 페이지를 찢어버렸어.

en: Someone tried to poison our dog's food.
ko: 누가 우리 개 밥에 독을 섞으려고 했어.

en: Who teaches you French?
Someone must have left it there.
I'll arrange for someone to pick you up at your home.
Can somebody get that?
Who taught you how to dance?
I feel listless and have a throbbing headache.
The tarantula seized its victim very quickly.
It's duck soup for a girl of easy virtue to find a new man.
ko: 헤픈 여자가 새 남자 사귀는 건 식은 죽 먹기지.

en: It goes without saying that diligence is the key to success.
ko: 부지런함이 성공의 열쇠라는 건 말할 필요도 없지.

en: Mr Tamori, may I introduce Mr Sanma Akashiya?
ko: 타모리 씨, 아카시야 산마 씨를 소개해 드릴게요.

en: The telephone is out of order, Mr Tamori.
A sigh fell from her lips.
Don't hesitate to ask me any questions.
ko: 궁금한 거 있으면 주저 말고 물어봐.

en: He who hesitates is lost.
ko: 망설이는 사람은 기회를 놓치게 되어 있어.

en: Without a moment's hesitation, they took drastic action against the conspiracy.
ko: 그들은 망설임 없이 그 음모에 대해 단호한 조치를 취했어.

en: Choose such friends as will benefit you, they say.
ko: 너한테 도움이 되는 친구를 사귀라는 말이 있어.

en: Rather than doing any good, the rain did a great deal of harm to the crop.
ko: 그 비는 도움이 되기는커녕 농작물에 큰 피해만 줬어.

en: Any book will do as long as it is instructive.
I was afraid it would not work out well and sure enough it failed.
ko: 잘 안될까 봐 걱정했는데 아니나 다를까 실패했어.

en: Try solving the problem.
Let's take it for a month on trial.
ko: 한 달 동안 시험 삼아 써보자.

en: No, don't go yet.
No! After you do your homework, you can watch television.
ko: 안 돼! 숙제 다 하고 나서 텔레비전 봐.

en: The villagers were displaced by the construction of a dam.
ko: 댐 건설 때문에 마을 사람들이 쫓겨났어.

en: There was a water mill below the dam.
The dam gave way and sent a great flush of water down the valley.
ko: 댐이 무너지면서 계곡 아래로 엄청난 물줄기가 쏟아졌어.

en: Pipe down, otherwise you will be hauled out.
ko: 조용히 해, 안 그러면 쫓겨날 줄 알아.

en: Tama sometimes goes for a walk by himself.
Onions cook more quickly than potatoes.
Sometimes her free manner seems rude.
ko: 가끔 그 여자의 자유분방한 태도가 무례하게 느껴져.

en: It's no crime to skip breakfast once in a while.
ko: 가끔 아침 거르는 게 큰 죄는 아니잖아.

en: It's no crime to just idle the whole day once in a while.
ko: 가끔 하루 종일 빈둥거리는 게 잘못은 아니잖아.

en: You can't just work all day every day. You need to take a vacation once in a while.
ko: 매일 일만 할 수는 없지. 가끔은 휴가도 좀 가야 해.

en: Sometimes it's good for a married couple to go to a hot spring together—just the two of them.
ko: 가끔은 부부끼리만 온천 여행 가는 것도 좋아.

en: Use your head for a change.
Once in a while, I visit the theater.
Why don't you dine out with me for a change?
ko: 기분 전환 삼아 나랑 외식하는 건 어때요?

en: It's okay to take it easy sometimes.
You need to enjoy yourself and have fun once in a while.
ko: 가끔은 즐기면서 재미있게 지낼 필요도 있어요.

en: How about dining out for a change?
ko: 기분 전환도 할 겸 외식하는 건 어때요?

en: Get out and have good clean fun once in a while.
ko: 가끔은 밖에 나가서 건전하게 좀 놀고 그래요.

en: Let's dine out for a change.
Come and see me once in a while.
Once in a while, the prophet indulges in fantasy.
More have repented speech than silence.
ko: 침묵하는 것보다 말을 해서 후회하는 사람이 더 많아요.

en: It happened that her husband was a dentist.
ko: 어쩌다 보니 그 사람 남편이 치과의사였어요.

en: It happened that I was in her room.
ko: 어쩌다 보니 제가 그 여자 방에 있었어요.

en: It happened that I knew her by sight.
ko: 그 여자 얼굴 정도는 아는 사이였어요.

en: It so happened that they were not there.
It happened that he was ill.
It chances that he is off duty today.
It happened that he was out.
It fell out that he could not come in time.
ko: 일이 꼬여서 그 사람이 제시간에 못 왔어요.

en: It happened that I met Mr Uno on the street.
That topic is too intimate to share with casual acquaintances.
ko: 그 얘기는 그냥 아는 사이에서 하기엔 너무 개인적이에요.

en: As it happened, I had no money with me.
ko: 하필이면 그때 수중에 돈이 하나도 없었어요.

en: It happened that we met at the station.
It happened that we were in London.
It happened that I met her in Tokyo.
I chanced to see him in town.
As it happens, I have left the book at home.
He was evidently surprised when he came across me.
ko: 저랑 마주쳤을 때 그 사람이 분명히 놀란 눈치였어요.

en: It so happens that today is my birthday.
Mike happened to have been absent from school.
I had a chance to meet him in Paris.
ko: 파리에서 우연히 그를 만날 기회가 있었어요.

en: It happened that the train was delayed on account of snow.
It so happened that he was absent from school that day.
ko: 하필 그날 그가 학교에 안 왔어요.

en: It happened that the day was my birthday.
There happened to be a train accident early that morning.
ko: 그날 새벽에 마침 열차 사고가 있었어요.

en: It happened that I met her at the station yesterday.
ko: 어제 역에서 우연히 그 여자를 만났어요.

en: It so happened that I had no money with me.
It happened that I sat next to her at a meeting.
ko: 모임에서 어쩌다 보니 그 여자 옆자리에 앉게 됐어요.

en: Just take my word for it.
You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.
ko: 희생 없이는 아무것도 얻을 수 없어요.

en: Stop shooting the breeze and get to work!
It is likely to rain tomorrow.
It is probable that she will come.
Perhaps she doesn't remember my birthday.
ko: 아마 제 생일을 기억 못 할지도 몰라요.

en: I should say he is a little angry.
ko: 제 생각엔 그 사람 좀 화난 것 같아요.

en: Maybe the impulse was working upon her subconscious.
ko: 아마 무의식중에 그런 충동이 생겼나 봐요.

en: They'll probably come by car.
Maybe he will be a good teacher.
The chances are that he will succeed.
The chances are that he will win.
There is a chance that he will pass the exam.
ko: 그 사람 시험에 합격할 수도 있어요.

en: He will probably forget to return my book.
ko: 걔 아마 내 책 돌려주는 거 까먹을걸.

en: It may be that he will never be famous.
Probably he will come soon.
Chances are that he has not heard the news yet.
ko: 걔 아직 그 소식 못 들었을걸.

en: It is possible that he may know the fact.
It is likely that he has made such a careless mistake.
ko: 걔가 그런 어이없는 실수를 했을 수도 있어.

en: It is probable that he forgot about it.
He may well be right.
I guess that would be all right.
The chances are that the boss will send you to California.
Possibly, the accident will delay his arrival.
ko: 사고 때문에 걔 좀 늦게 도착할지도 몰라.

en: Possibly the factory will be closed down next week.
ko: 다음 주에 공장 문 닫을 수도 있대.

en: Perhaps it will rain in the afternoon.
Doubtless you have heard the news.
The tea leaves all point to a merger, if you ask me.
ko: 내가 보기엔 모든 정황이 합병을 가리키고 있어.

en: It's going to rain.
Maybe, but I can't catch the drift of even simple situations.
ko: 그럴 수도 있는데, 난 단순한 상황 파악도 잘 안 돼.

en: Maybe, but he wants me to stop cold turkey.
ko: 그럴지도 모르지만, 걔는 내가 단번에 끊길 바라.

en: I guess that's just the way the cookie crumbles.
In all probability, the cabinet will fall.
In all probability, the money will not be paid.
ko: 아마 그 돈 못 받을 거야.

en: I dare say you are right.
Maybe he has lots of girlfriends.
I should say he won't come.
The chances are that you can pass the test.
ko: 너 시험 합격할 수 있을 거야.

en: I've reserved a double.
I'd like a double room.
I'd like a double with a bath.
Double, please.
You're tough.
Loose jackets are the latest fad.
I have been there scores of times.
You do such a thing once too often and get punished.
ko: 꼬리가 길면 밟히는 법이야, 그러다 벌 받아.

en: Why don't you give up smoking?
Each package contains a score of cigarettes.
ko: 한 갑에 담배 스무 개비 들어있어.

en: I want to get cigarettes.
67% of those who never smoked said they worried about the health effects of passive smoking.
ko: 비흡연자의 67%가 간접흡연이 건강에 해로울까 봐 걱정된대.

en: I wish I could give up smoking.
Put out your cigarette. Smoking's not permitted here.
You must stop smoking.
You will live longer if you don't smoke.
ko: 담배 안 피우면 더 오래 살 거야.

en: Don't you smoke?
I'd rather you didn't smoke so much.
Would you mind not smoking?
ko: 담배 좀 안 피워주면 안 돼?

en: Do you mind my smoking?
Smoking is permitted.
Do you mind if I smoke?
I don't mind if you smoke.
Would you mind if I smoke?
The number of people who smoke is increasing, so cancer will soon be the most common cause of death.
ko: 흡연자가 늘고 있어서 암이 곧 사망 원인 1위가 될 거야.

en: Stop smoking.
It is often pointed out that smoking is a danger to health.
Smoking does you harm.
It is not good for the health to smoke too much.
ko: 담배 너무 많이 피우는 건 건강에 좋지 않아.

en: He made a resolve to stop smoking.
To give up smoking is not easy, but you should for the sake of your health.
ko: 담배 끊는 게 쉽지는 않지만, 건강을 위해서 끊어야 해.

en: I long for a smoke.
You'd better give up smoking.
If George doesn't stop smoking, he will run the risk of developing lung cancer.
ko: 조지가 담배 안 끊으면 폐암에 걸릴 위험이 있어.

en: Please give up smoking.
Smokers are asked to occupy the rear seats.
Let me have a cigarette.
Smoking does much harm but no good.
For thy sake, tobacco, I would do anything but die.
ko: 담배야, 너를 위해서라면 죽는 것 말고는 뭐든 하겠어.

en: Smoking has affected his health.
Tobacco acts on the brain.
You must not smoke.
Keep in mind that smoking is not good for your health.
ko: 담배가 건강에 안 좋다는 걸 명심해.

en: The argument that smoking is injurious has become accepted.
ko: 흡연이 해롭다는 주장은 이제 당연하게 받아들여져.

en: Smoking is dangerous to health.
It goes without saying that smoking is bad for the health.
ko: 담배가 건강에 나쁘다는 건 말할 필요도 없지.

en: Smoking is not good for the health.
Smoking is bad for your health.
I don't smoke.
I give my pledge that I will quit smoking.
He says he will not give up smoking.
I prefer cigarettes smoked on the porch.
ko: 난 테라스에서 피우는 담배가 더 좋아.

en: It's hard to shake the smoking habit.
You are requested not to smoke.
Would you mind if I smoked?
You should smoke less.
Excessive smoking will injure your health.
Would you please put out your cigarette?
Cigarette smoke fouls the air in a room.
ko: 담배 연기가 방 안 공기를 탁하게 만들어.

en: Tobacco smoke is productive of cancer.
A new tax has been imposed on cigarettes.
There is a heavy tax on tobacco.
Let this smoky air out of the room and let some fresh air in.
ko: 매캐한 연기 좀 내보내고 환기 좀 시키자.

en: Sometimes I smoke just to give my hands something to do.
ko: 가끔은 그냥 손이 심심해서 담배를 피우기도 해.

en: Every time cigarettes go up in price, many people try to give up smoking.
ko: 담뱃값이 오를 때마다 많은 사람들이 금연을 시도해.

en: I was aching for a cigarette.
ko: 담배 피우고 싶어서 미치는 줄 알았어.

en: Please forget this, for the love of God.
Danny has no sense of beauty.
I want to study abroad, even if my parents are against it.
I would keep waiting for you if I had to stay awake past midnight.
ko: 자정을 넘겨서까지라도 널 계속 기다릴 거야.

en: I will go even if it rains tomorrow.
Even if you are busy, you should keep your promise.
I don't mind even if she doesn't come.
Even if she comes to see me, tell her I am not at home.
ko: 그녀가 보러 와도 나 없다고 말해줘.

en: Whatever she says, I don't believe her.
ko: 그녀가 뭐라고 하든 난 안 믿어.

en: Even if he is busy, he will come.
